      • error

        public char[] error()
        Description copied from interface: Core
        Return a description of the last error that occured. Call this after enc or dec returns 0. The returned string does not need to be free'd.
        Specified by:
        error in interface Core

      • setup

        public void setup(PubT pub,
                  MskT msk)
        Description copied from interface: Core
        Generate a public key and corresponding master secret key, and assign the *pub and *msk pointers to them. The space used may be later freed by calling pub_free(*pub) and msk_free(*msk).
        Specified by:
        setup in interface Core

      • keygen

        public PrvT keygen(PubT pub,
                   MskT msk,
                   java.lang.String[] attributes)
        Description copied from interface: Core
        Generate a private key with the given set of attributes. The final argument should be a null terminated array of pointers to strings, one for each attribute.
        Specified by:
        keygen in interface Core

      • enc

        public CphT enc(PubT pub,
                java.lang.String policy)
        Description copied from interface: Core
        Pick a random group element and encrypt it under the specified access policy. The resulting ciphertext is returned and the element_t given as an argument (which need not be initialized) is set to the random group element. After using this function, it is normal to extract the random data in m using the pbc functions element_length_in_bytes and element_to_bytes and use it as a key for hybrid encryption. The policy is specified as a simple string which encodes a postorder traversal of threshold tree defining the access policy. As an example, "foo bar fim 2of3 baf 1of2" specifies a policy with two threshold gates and four leaves. It is not possible to specify an attribute with whitespace in it (although "_" is allowed). Numerical attributes and any other fancy stuff are not supported. Returns null if an error occured, in which case a description can be retrieved by calling error().
        Specified by:
        enc in interface Core

      • dec

        public it.unisa.dia.gas.jpbc.Element dec(PubT pub,
                                         PrvT prv,
                                         CphT cph)
        Description copied from interface: Core
        Decrypt the specified ciphertext using the given private key, filling in the provided element m (which need not be initialized) with the result. Returns true if decryption succeeded, false if this key does not satisfy the policy of the ciphertext (in which case m is unaltered).
        Specified by:
        dec in interface Core
